titleStmt.title: Letter to John Murray III
Letter to John Murray III, 18 March 1865
titleStmt.author: Livingstone, David, 1813-1873

publicationStmt.publisher: Wellcome Centre for the History of Medicine, UCL

sourceDesc.bibl: National Library of Scotland; MS. 42421, ff. 49r-52v

revisionDesc.change: 2008-11-06 Caroline OveryInitial Transcription by Caroline Overy

div.p:
I fear that I don't
see clearly what
the note means
by B - C D. -
sheets of these
marks were correct
ed & returned from
printer as slips 17a-24a
- 25a 32a
3d Revise which
I now send to you
to look at & then send
to Mr Clowes.
Lately a slip of
25a 33a came
marked by the
printer.

Revise of D duplicates
First Revise - I
incorporated the
corrt by Oswell in
it but some are
awaiting as for
instance first
line of II chaptr
wants the date I
again supply - the
slips 25a 17a-24a &
25a 33a had better
go out of hand now.
In matter consecutive
to 33a I send tomorrow
as corrected by
Oswell i.e. 33a -
43a after I have
answered some
questions in
the matter.

If Sheet B is not
quite out of hand
could the following
words be inserted
in their proper
place as I have
not done full
justice to Mr Skead
zeal & labours
"the Luawe was
all carefully
sounded by and
surveyed by
Mr Skead, whose skilful &
energetic labours
both on that river
and afterwards
in the lower
Zambesi were
deserving of all
praise".

Could I procure
the loan of that
part of Denman
& Clapperton about
Mahometan
proselytism or
of any other
information
on that head.
I have Baile.
If you have
not secured
a copy of the
book for Mr
Moffat I think
Mr Webb will give
one.

Today I send
First revise 1923 -
-196 - First proof
201-217.
